description: Stores distinctive examples of the character's speech patterns and signature phrases. This component aims to define a unique verbal style that reflects their core personality, background, education, and any linguistic idiosyncrasies, enabling an LLM to generate dialogue that is not only in-character but also memorable and individual.

oneOf.description: Legacy format: A simple string providing a concrete example of how the character speaks.

type.description: The type or category of this speech pattern (e.g., 'metaphor', 'catchphrase', 'idiom').

contexts.description: Optional array of context strings indicating when this pattern is typically used.

examples.description: Array of concrete examples demonstrating this speech pattern.

oneOf.description: Structured format: An object defining a speech pattern with type classification, optional contexts, and examples.

patterns.description: An array of speech patterns, each either a simple string (legacy format) or a structured object with type, optional contexts, and examples. These patterns should showcase the character's unique vocabulary, sentence structures, cadence, catchphrases, verbal tics, or characteristic ways of expressing emotions.
